Package com.library.database.repositories

Class BookRepository

java.lang.Object
com.library.database.repositories.Repository<Book>
com.library.database.repositories.BookRepository
All Implemented Interfaces:
AutoCloseable
public class BookRepository extends Repository<Book>
The BookRepository class provides specific repository operations for managing Book entities using Hibernate as the underlying ORM (Object-Relational Mapping) framework. It extends the generic Repository class and implements methods for finding books by various criteria.

This class follows the Singleton design pattern to ensure a single instance is used across the application, promoting consistency in entity management.

Usage of this class includes finding books by ID, retrieving all books, getting books by ID, deleting multiple books, finding books by ISBN, title, and inventory number.

Note: This class is thread-safe due to the Singleton pattern, making it suitable for use in multi-threaded environments.

    • findById

      public Optional<Book> findById(Long id) throws org.hibernate.HibernateException
      Find and return a book by its unique identifier (ID). This method utilizes the Hibernate session to perform the database operation. If the book is not found, an empty Optional is returned.
      Specified by:
      findById in class Repository<Book>
      Parameters:
      id - The ID of the book to find.
      Returns:
      An Optional containing the found book, or empty if the book is not found.
      Throws:
      org.hibernate.HibernateException - If an error occurs during the Hibernate operation.

    • findAll

      public List<Book> findAll() throws org.hibernate.HibernateException
      Retrieve and return a list of all books. This method uses Hibernates HQL (Hibernate Query Language) to execute a query to fetch all books.
      Specified by:
      findAll in class Repository<Book>
      Returns:
      A list containing all books.
      Throws:
      org.hibernate.HibernateException - If an error occurs during the Hibernate operation.

    • getById

      public Book getById(Long id)
      Get and return a book by its unique identifier (ID). This method is similar to findById(Long), but it returns the book directly instead of wrapping it in an Optional. If the book is not found, it returns null.
      Specified by:
      getById in class Repository<Book>
      Parameters:
      id - The ID of the book to get.
      Returns:
      The found book, or null if the book is not found.
      Throws:
      org.hibernate.HibernateException - If an error occurs during the Hibernate operation.
